content: Tattooed Chef brand consumption is measured by Spin IRI in Q2 was 23.3 million and grew 140% versus the prior your quarter further, our diversification momentum in the grocery and mass channels continued with Chef consumption sales more than tripling in total dollars versus the prior year quarter. For the second quarter of 2022, cost of goods sold rose 36.7% to $57.4 million, up from $42 million in second quarter of 2021. Gross profit was $740,000 in second quarter of 2022 or 1.3% of revenue compared to $8.3 million or 16.5% of revenue in the second quarter 2021. Freight on finished goods was roughly $6.7 million in the 2022 second quarter, and equated to roughly 11.4% of total revenue this quarter. Operating expenses rose 48.3% to $24.3 million for the second quarter 2022 from $16.4 million in the second quarter 2021, reflecting ongoing investments in the Tattooed Chef brand, sales channel expansion and higher public company costs. Net loss in the second quarter of 2022 was $26.4 million or negative $0.32 per diluted share as compared to a net loss of $57.5 million or negative $0.70 per diluted share in second quarter 2021, adjusted EBITDA loss was $20.5 million in the second quarter 2022, compared to adjusted EBITDA loss of $6.1 million in second quarter 2021. Net cash used in operating activities for the three months ended June 30, 2022 was $23.7 million, which represented a sequential decline in cash consumed from operating activities in the first quarter of 2022. In the 2022 second quarter, 0.8 million in cash was consumed by working capital activities as accounts receivable generated $14.4 million, which was offset by cash consumed by inventory, prepaid expenses and current liabilities. Capital expenditures during second quarter 2022 were $6.8 million and primarily reflected the purchase of new automated manufacturing equipment, the installation of the chip line at our New Mexico operation, equipment for our new dedicated cold storage facility and the construction of an in-house laboratory in Paramount.
